_header: In a summer season when soft was the sun
Note: See also for ‘A’ Texts 2458; for ‘C’ Texts, see 2460; for former 745, see Cambridge UK, Gonville & Caius College 669/646 copy of 2460.
Subjects: dream visions; sins, deadly; prayers, asked on behalf of scribes; scribes; penitence
_description: William Langland, Vision of Piers Plowman, the ‘B’ text

Bod814.First Lines:
In a somer sesoun whan softe was þe sonneI shop me in to a
                    shrowde as y a shep were…
Bod814.Last Lines:
…And sende me hap and hele til y haue pieris þe
                    ploughmanAnd siþ he gradde aftir grace til y gan a wake
Bod814.Note:
‘C’ Text, Prologue to II.131; ‘A’ Text,
                    II.90-222; ‘B’ Text, III.1-XX.386.
Bod814.Attributed Title:
Passus primus de visione petri le ploughman (f. 3v, after
                    Prologue)

BodRawC813.First Lines:
I warnne yow workmen winn whyell yow mayfor
                    hungerward hastythto chafferrr fiue be fullffillyd shall
                    ffamyne shall ariese…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…that gregorius good childerne han evell disspendidethen shall þe abbotte of abingdone and all his issue for everehave a knocke of a king and an vncuarrable wondeand or
                        this kyng com kame shall an 11fyniys

BodRawD1062.Transcription:
when ys v fulfy[lled]and a maden hath ye mastery for se your albeon
                    wronge on monkes hedes worke on work men
                    whyle your lyfe will last for fearnes & honger
                    death hye on faste
                    and davyth ye dychar shall dye for honger yf god
                    proued not remedie ye sonner.

                    327, 321–22, and 330–31 of Kane  and  Donaldson (1988)

BLAdd10574.First Lines:
In a somer sesoun whan softe was þe sunneI shop me in to a
                    shrowde as y a sheep were…
BLAdd10574.Last Lines:
…and accorde wiþ conscience and kisse eiþer
                    oþerThus þurgh hende speche entrid þe frere…
BLAdd10574.Note:
‘C’ Text, Prologue to II.128; ‘A’ Text,
                    II.86-198; ‘B’ Text, III.1-XX.354; ends imperfectly and completed by
                    Dr Adam Clarke (1762?-1832). Medieval text ends incomplete (with catchword
                    ‘and cam’ for further quire) on f. 91v; remaining lines
                    supplied by a modern hand on lined paper on ff. 92r-v, ending f.
                        92v.
BLAdd10574.Attributed Title:
…and sende me hap & hele tyl I have Peris the Ploughman / And
                    sith he gradde after Grace tyl y gan awake (92v); Explicit Visio
                    Petri Ploughman (f. 92v; modern hand)

…whene þou se the sonne a mysse & thre ij monkes
                    headesand a mayed bere rule & reigne & multiply by eyghtthen

                    treue…

                    plowman’.

BLHar3954.First Lines: IN a somer sesoun qwan soft was þe sunneI schop me in a schroude as I a schep were…

BLLan398.First Lines:
…Crist kepe þe sire kyng and þi kyngricheAnd leue
                    þe lede þi land so lewet þe louþeAnd fore riȝtful
                    rewelyng be rewarded in heuene[skips a line]And sithen in þe heir
                    an heþ an aungel of heuene…
BLLan398.Last Lines:
…haue no kende knowyng quatȝ I ȝette mote I lerne
                    bettre[ ] what craft in my corps it comseth and where[skips a
                    line][ ]w dotede daffe quatȝ sche dulle arn þi wittes
BLLan398.Note:
Originally part of first quire of Oxford,  Bodleian Library Rawlinson poet. 38 (SC 15563) (see above);
